com.orientechnologies.orient.core.storage.impl.local.statistic

Class OPerformanceStatisticManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orientechnologies.orient.core.storage.impl.local.statistic.OPerformanceStatisticManager

  • public class OPerformanceStatisticManager
extends Object
    Aggregator of performance statistic for whole storage. Allows to gather performance statistic for single thread or for all threads in storage.

    In case of gathering statistics for single thread statistic for all period is gathered and average values are provided. If you gather statistic for whole system time series of measurements are provided.

    You can not measure statistic for whole system and for chosen threads at the same time.

    To gather statistic for single thread use following workflow:

    1. Call startThreadMonitoring()
    2. Execute database commands
    3. Call stopThreadMonitoring()

    Instance of OSessionStoragePerformanceStatistic returned as result of call of last method will contain all performance data are gathered during storage monitoring.

    To gather statistic for whole system use following workflow:

    1. Call startMonitoring()
    2. During monitoring of storage use getXXX methods to get information about performance numbers
    3. At the end of monitoring call stopMonitoring()

    You may access performance data both after you stopped gathering statistic and during gathering of statistic. You may manipulate by manager directly from Java or from JMX from bean with name which consist of prefix MBEAN_PREFIX and storage name.

    If ODurableComponent participates in performance monitoring it has to register itself using method registerComponent(String)

    • Method Detail

      • startThreadMonitoring

        public void startThreadMonitoring()
        Starts performance monitoring only for single thread. After call of this method you can not start system wide monitoring till call of stopThreadMonitoring() is performed.

      • stopThreadMonitoring

        public OSessionStoragePerformanceStatistic stopThreadMonitoring()
        Returns:
        Container for gathered performance statistic or null if startThreadMonitoring() is not called.

      • startMonitoring

        public void startMonitoring()
        Starts performance monitoring only for whole system.

        After call of this method you can not start monitoring on thread level till call of stopMonitoring() is performed.

      • stopMonitoring

        public void stopMonitoring()
        Stops monitoring of performance statistic for whole system.

      • registerMBean

        public void registerMBean(String storageName,
                          int storageId)
        Registers JMX bean for current manager.
        Parameters:
        storageName - Name of storage of given manager
        storageId - Id of storage of given manager
        See Also:
        OStorage.getName(), OIdentifiableStorage.getId()

        storageName - Name of storage of given manager
        storageId - Id of storage of given manager
        See Also:

      • getComponentNames

        public Set<String> getComponentNames()
        Returns:
        Set of names of components for which performance statistic is gathered.

      • getSessionPerformanceStatistic

        public OSessionStoragePerformanceStatistic getSessionPerformanceStatistic()
        Returns:
        Instance of performance container which is used to gathering data about storage performance statistic or null if none of both methods startMonitoring() or startThreadMonitoring() are called.

      • getAmountOfPagesPerOperation

        public long getAmountOfPagesPerOperation(String componentName)
        Average amount of pages which were read from cache for component with given name during single data operation.

        If null value is passed or data for component with passed in name does not exist then -1 will be returned.

        Parameters:
        componentName - Name of component data of which should be returned. Name is case sensitive.
        Returns:
        Average amount of pages which were read from cache for component with given name during single data operation or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

      • getCacheHits

        public int getCacheHits()
        Returns:
        Percent of cache hits or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

      • getCacheHits

        public int getCacheHits(String componentName)
        Percent of cache hits for component name of which is passed as method argument. If null value is passed then value for whole system will be returned. If data for component with passed in name does not exist then -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        componentName - Name of component data of which should be returned. Name is case sensitive.
        Returns:
        Percent of cache hits or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

      • getCommitTime

        public long getCommitTime()
        Returns:
        Average time of commit of atomic operation in nanoseconds or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

      • getReadSpeedFromCacheInPages

        public long getReadSpeedFromCacheInPages()
        Returns:
        Read speed of data in pages per second on cache level or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

      • getReadSpeedFromCacheInPages

        public long getReadSpeedFromCacheInPages(String componentName)
        Read speed of data in pages per second on cache level for component name of which is passed as method argument. If null value is passed then value for whole system will be returned. If data for component with passed in name does not exist then -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        componentName - Name of component data of which should be returned. Name is case sensitive.
        Returns:
        Read speed of data in pages per second on cache level or value which is less than 0, which means that value cannot be calculated.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public long getWriteCachePagesPerFlush()

        Returns:

      • getFullCheckpointCount

        public long getFullCheckpointCount()
        Returns:
        Amount of times full checkpoint operations is called on storage, or -1 if this value is undefined.

      • getReadCacheSize

        public long getReadCacheSize()
        Returns:
        Size of read cache in bytes or -1 if value is undefined.

      • getWriteCacheSize

        Returns:
        Size of write cache in bytes or -1 if value is undefined.

      • getExclusiveWriteCacheSize

        public long getExclusiveWriteCacheSize()
        Returns:
        Size of part of write cache which exclusively belongs to only this cache or -1 if value is undefined

      • getWriteCacheOverflowCount

        public long getWriteCacheOverflowCount()
        Returns:
        Amount of times when size of write cache is not enough to keep dirty pages and flush of write cache is forced, or -1 if this value is undefined.

      • getWALSize

        public long getWALSize()
        Returns:
        Size of WAL in bytes or -1 if value is undefined

      • getWALCacheOverflowCount

        public long getWALCacheOverflowCount()
        Returns:
        Amount of times when WAL cache is completely filled in and force flush is needed or -1 if value is undefined

      • getWALLogRecordTime

        public long getWALLogRecordTime()
        Returns:
        time which is spent on logging of single record or -1 if value is undefined.

      • getWALStopAOLogRecordTime
